name: St. Irenaeus of Lyons
summary: Irenaeus of Lyons was a bishop, theologian, and one of the most important early Christian writers. He was a student of Polycarp, who was a disciple of John the Apostle, making Irenaeus part of the apostolic succession. His major work 'Against Heresies' is a comprehensive refutation of Gnosticism and an important early statement of orthodox Christian doctrine. He emphasized the unity of the Church and the importance of apostolic tradition. He is considered a Doctor of the Church and was martyred during the persecution of Septimius Severus.
keyQuotes: The glory of God is man fully alive, and the life of man is the vision of God.
